DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no indicator that asks whether measurable disease is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to measurable disease being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Capable of being measured.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Present; the period of time that is happening now.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is measurable disease present?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is measurable disease present?

ReferenceDocuments.name: 1-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Add instruction to template form: (only applicable in studies where there is residual disease at baseline)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease defined as at least one lesion that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable disease as defined in Section 11.0

ReferenceDocuments.description: Radiologically measurable or clinically evaluable disease as defined in section 11.0

ReferenceDocuments.description: Was measurable disease present

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the recurrence of disease documented by clinically evident measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease documented by radiographic findings?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease documented by clinical, radiographic, or histologic criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease as defined by the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease (by RECIST 1.1 criteria) or non-measurable and present in at least one non-liver site, 1.5 cm or greater and visualized on PET/CT with [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI142 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease (by RECIST 1.1 criteria) or non-measurable and present in at least one non-liver site, where presence is defined as 1.5 cm or greater and visualized on PET/CT with [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease as defined by RECIST 1.1

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Could metastatic disease be measured?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have radiographically measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is this lesion measurable by RECIST?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evaluable or measurable disease outside the CNS

ReferenceDocuments.name: EA1142_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease (by RECIST 1.1 criteria) or non-measurable and present in at least one non-liver site, where presence is defined as 1.5 cm or greater and documented by biopsy or at least two imaging methods?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of measurable disease outside of the radiation field at the time of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have intracranial measurable disease at baseline?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: New measureable disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measureable CNS disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the measureable disease restricted to a solitary lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have RECIST 1.1 measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI142_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease (by RECIST 1.1 criteria) and is 1.5 cm or greater in longest dimension OR non-measurable disease that is 1.5 cm or greater in longest dimension?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease as defined by RECIST 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients who had no measurable disease at enrollment, has the patient developed measurable or evaluable disease since enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evaluable disease (defined as RECIST 1.1 measurable disease) OR non-measurable disease (defined as solid and/or cystic abnormalities on radiographic imaging that do not meet RECIST 1.1 definitions for target lesions OR ascites and/or pleural effusion that has been pathologically demonstrated to be disease-related in the setting of a CA125 equal to or greater than 2x upper limit of normal (ULN))?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease, documented by radiographic imaging per LCH-specific RECIST/PERSIST criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evaluable disease or measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have measurable disease?
